metadata.title: CVE-2021-47171 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:usb: fix memory leak in smsc75xx_bind Syzbot reported memory leak insmsc75xx_bind(). The problem was is non-freed memory in case of errorsafter memory allocation. backtrace: [<ffffffff84245b62>] kmallocinclude/linux/slab.h:556 [inline] [<ffffffff84245b62>] kzallocinclude/linux/slab.h:686 [inline] [<ffffffff84245b62>]smsc75xx_bind+0x7a/0x334 drivers/net/usb/smsc75xx.c:1460[<ffffffff82b5b2e6>] usbnet_probe+0x3b6/0xc30 drivers/net/usb/usbnet.c:1728

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-kvm - 4.4.0-1136.146
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1104-fips - 4.4.0-1104.111
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-258.292').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.146').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1173.188').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.111').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
